title: Burst water main causes flooding in Islington
description: A respite centre has been set up for affected residents as 40 firefighters are called to the scene.
content:
A burst water main has flooded roads in north London.
The London Fire Brigade (LFB) said the burst 30in (76cm) pipe was causing flooding between Caledonian Road and Twyford Street, to the junction of Thornhill Bridge Wharf and Caledonian Road in Isli... [719 chars]

title: 'Equal in decay' - Mayweather v Pacquiao is another boxing 'carnival'
description: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao fight in September in a rematch of their 2015 blockbuster, but with both men nearning 50 years old, is it a fight that can deliver?
content:
Floyd Mayweather, 49, and Manny Pacquiao, 47, will contest their rematch in a professional bout in Las Vegas on 19 September.
It is a weird fight, "a carnival" as Steve Bunce aptly puts it. It is not one that boxing fans have been clamouring for. Nor... [4774 chars]

title: Man admits stealing Fabergé egg and watch worth £2m
description: Enzo Conticello stole a handbag, containing the items, in Soho, Southwark Crown Court hears.
content:
A man has admitted stealing a handbag containing a Fabergé egg and watch thought to be worth more than £2m.
Enzo Conticello, 29, of no fixed address, stole from the victim in Soho, central London, on 7 November 2024, Southwark Crown Court heard.
The ... [360 chars]

title: Reform’s Danny Kruger criticises UK’s ‘totally unregulated sexual economy’
description: Former Conservative laments divorce changes and says Reform UK will pursue policies to boost birthrate
content:
The UK is “suffering from having a totally unregulated sexual economy”, the Reform MP Danny Kruger has said, and he indicated he expected the party to have a “limited but important role” in resetting sexual culture.

title: Louvre museum director resigns months after high-profile heist
description: Laurence des Carrs submitted her resignation to President Emmanel Macron, who said it was "an act of responsibility".
content:
The director of the Louvre museum in Paris has resigned, months after the high-profile theft of France's crown jewels from one of the world's most visited art galleries.
